climbs.name: Tar Paper and Shingles
climbs.fa: Unknown, First Lead: Dave LePere & Steve Kravchuck, July 2000

content.description:
Tackles the obvious roof via a crack on the left side (hence the name) and higher moves left to join

Cruntched

for it's finish.
content.location:
Between

Cruntched

and

Jet Blue

on the right side of the south face.

content.description:
Twin cracks down low lead to a steeper section where

Love and Money

moves left then continue straight up a wider crack to the top.
content.location:
Shared start with

Love and Money

, left of a triangular section of rock on the right side of the face.

content.description: Steep slab climbing at the crux leads to a horizontal crack and then easier climbing above leads to anchors.
content.location: Left side of the south face on a smooth portion of slabby rock.

climbs.name: Slipping Away
climbs.fa: Rob Stauder, Brad Singer, Eric Odenthal & Anthony Scalise, October 2000

content.description: Steep slab moves on very gritty rock - a little slice of Joshua Tree in the mountains; more traffic might help to clean up this route.
content.location: Far right side of the face on a triangular-shaped section of rock.

content.description:
Start as for

Slipping Away

then move right and climb the gritty rounded arete. Might be worth bolting if it cleans up some more.
content.protection:
TR from anchors atop

Slipping Away
content.location:
Just right of

Slipping Away

on the arete.

climbs.name: Silence of the Cams
climbs.fa: Unknown, First Lead  Chris Miller, Brad Singer & Pete Paredes, October 2000

content.description:
Start up a Y-shaped crack system and take the left branch until it dies out then climb up and right past two bolts (crux) to reach a hand crack, shared with

Loan Me a Dime

, which leads to the top.
content.protection: Gear to 3 inches, 2 bolts, bolted anchor/rap
content.location:
Right side of the south face between

The Hex Files

and

Silence of the Cams

at a Y-shaped crack system.

content.description:
A fun outing up featured face that pulls a small roof (crux) and continues up and slightly left on easier ground to anchors on a ledge.

The anchors for this route are set too far back causing more than acceptable rope drag; this situation should be soon remedied.
content.location:
Just right of

Jet Blue

and right of a short right-facing corner.

content.description: Climb the crack just right of a smooth section of slab to a prominent horizontal crack and then move slightly right and follow the finger/hand crack to a ledge with bolted anchors.
content.location:
Left side of the south face and just right of a smooth section of slab with the route

Sweet Jane

.

content.description:
Twin cracks down low lead to a steeper section up and left that parallels

Sausage Medley

.

The anchors for this route are set too far back causing more than acceptable rope drag; this situation should be soon remedied.
content.location:
Just right of

Sausage Medley

on the right side of the face.

content.description:
Climbs a ramp to crux bulge down low then follows cracks higher to join

Silence of the Cams

for it's hand crack finish. If so desired the last bolt on

Silence of the Cams

can be clipped for additional protection.
content.location:
Center of the south face between

Silence of the Cams

and Cruntched and left of an obvious recessed area formed by a roof.

content.description: Climb the wide crack system in a right-facing corner exiting left at the top and then up and right to bolted anchors. As an alternative do a gear belay on top and then traverse to the bolted anchors or just walk-off.
content.protection: Gear to 4 inches or larger, bolted anchor/rap
content.location:
The obvious wide crack just left of

Sweet Jane

.

content.description:
Start left of the obvious wide corner system and climb a crack to access the face above which is peppered with cracks. Higher pass a shallow right-facing corner and more features that lead to the top of the rock then traverse right to bolted anchors. As an alternative do a gear belay on top and then traverse to the bolted anchors or just walk-off.

This route climbs like a slightly harder version of

The Sphynx

at Castle Rock in Big Bear.
content.location:
Far left side of the south face on a buttress left of

Left Untch Crack

.

climbs.name: Jet Blue
climbs.fa: Eric Odenthal, August 2000, Direct Start: (TR) Chris Miller, September 2002

content.description:
Start just right of

Tar Paper and Shingles

and climbs a slanting hand crack in a right-facing corner to a roof. Clip a bolt, jet over the roof (crux) then cruise upwards past more bolts to the top on easier terrain.

A direct start has been done on TR that climbs the face directly below the current first bolt - the difficulty is unchanged.
content.protection: Gear to 2.5 inches, 4 bolts, bolted anchor/rap
content.location:
Right of center at an obvious recessed area between

Tar Paper and Shingles

and

Sausage Medley

.

content.description: Thin hands to start which leads into a pod feature and then exit the pod via a thin crack which leads to the top.
content.location:
Left side of the south face between

Cool Arrow

and

The Hex Files

.

climbs.name: The Hex Files
climbs.fa: Unknown, First Lead: Chris Miller, Brad Singer & Pete Paredes, October 2000

content.description:
Climbs a crack just right of

Iceman

which grows thinner the higher you go before petering out into face past two bolts.
content.protection: Gear to 3 inches, 2 bolts, bolted anchor/rap
content.location:
Center of the south face between

Iceman

and

Silence of the Cams

.

climbs.name: He said it was O.K.
climbs.fa: Bob Cable, Kenn Kenaga, Pat Brennan & Jeff Brennan, August 2001

content.description: Intermittent seams and cracks characterize this somewhat run-out route - best be solid at the grade for this one.
content.protection:
Gear to 1 inches (smallish nuts helpful), bolted anchor/rap shared with

Slipping Away
content.location:
Backside of the triangular block with

Slipping Away

(north facing).

content.description: This top-rope problem tackles a small overhang to corner system and finishes with face moves to top.
content.location:
Right of center on the south face between

Loan Me a Dime

and

Tar Paper and Shingles

.

content.description: Face climbing with micro-wires for protection leads to a horizontal crack and a short traverse left to a finishing hand crack.
content.protection: Gear to 3 inches including micro-wires, bolted anchor/rap
content.location:
Starts  midway between

Right Untch Crack

and

Iceman

.
